newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani money rates slip at close, seen stable.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani money rates slip at close, seen stable.

text.p: Pakistan's money market rates slipped towards the closed on Wednesday after opening higher on an improved liquidity and are likely to open at the same level on Thursday, dealers said.

"Today's open market operation by the State (central) Bank of Pakistan compelled some banks to cover their positions early as initial deals were struck around 18.50 percent and some at 19 percent," a dealer at KASB & Co said. "Later, the rates slid and substantial amounts changed hands at 16 to 17 percent."
One-week bids and offers were quoted around 15.50 to 16.25 percent, dealers said. -- Amir Zia 9221-5685192
